member.name: T:EPiServer.Web.WebControls.Calendar
member.summary: Displays a template based calendar where the calendar events are pages in EPiServer.
member.remarks:
Pages that will serve as events must at least have properties "EventStartDate" and "EventStopDate"
Example usage of Calendar.

member.name: M:EPiServer.Web.WebControls.Calendar.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of

member.summary: Create day prefix template for date
member.param: The date to created template for

member.summary: Created day suffix template for day
member.param: The date to create template for

member.summary: Create template for a calendar event
member.param: The page to created a event template for
Current date that page should be visibly on

member.name: M:EPiServer.Web.WebControls.Calendar.SetCalendarInterval
member.summary: Set begin and stop dates. Called when Calendar is about to create child controls.

member.summary: Check if event is recurring
member.returns: If event was recurring the specified day

member.name: M:EPiServer.Web.WebControls.Calendar.DateIsActive(System.DateTime)
member.summary: Is this method to check if a date has active events in it.
member.param: The date to compare with the event.
member.returns: True if there is an event on the date.
member.remarks: The date must be set to be rendered by the control.

member.name: M:EPiServer.Web.WebControls.Calendar.ValidatePages(EPiServer.Core.PageDataCollection)
member.summary: Method that validates that all pages are valid calendar pages.

member.name: P:EPiServer.Web.WebControls.Calendar.ActiveSelectedDates
member.summary: A collection of the dates with events on for the selected period.

member.name: P:EPiServer.Web.WebControls.Calendar.SelectedDates
member.summary: A collection of dates to be rendered. The control will render all dates from the first date in the collection to the last date.
member.remarks: The Collection should be sorted by Date.

member.name: P:EPiServer.Web.WebControls.Calendar.IgnoreInvalidPages
member.summary: If pages that does not qualify as calendar pages should be ignored.

member.name: P:EPiServer.Web.WebControls.Calendar.NumberOfDaysToRender
member.summary: Number of days to display at a time in the Calender.
member.remarks: Default value is 7

member.name: P:EPiServer.Web.WebControls.Calendar.PageTypeID
member.summary: Restrict events to the following PageTypeID.
member.remarks: By default no page type restriction is applied

member.name: P:EPiServer.Web.WebControls.Calendar.ExpandAllDays
member.summary: Shows all days even if there are no events on this day.
member.remarks: Default value is true.

member.name: P:EPiServer.Web.WebControls.Calendar.ReverseDateSortOrder
member.summary: If the dates for the calendar should be shown in reverse order. Default value is false.
member.remarks: The events for each day will still be sorted normally.

member.name: P:EPiServer.Web.WebControls.Calendar.MaxCount
member.summary: Set value to limit the amount of events that are rendered.
member.remarks: Default value is -1

member.name: P:EPiServer.Web.WebControls.Calendar.BeginDate
member.summary: Date of first day displayed in Calender. Is not used if SelectedDates is specified.
member.remarks: Default value is set to .

member.summary: Template for day prefix.

member.name: T:EPiServer.Web.WebControls.NewsList
member.summary: Control for rendering news list with specialized template for top level news.

remarks.para: NewsList has special templates for the first four news and a default , if you specify it will be used as fallback for the first four templates that have not been set.

If you have defined all templates except NewsTemplate, you will never see more than four news (you only have definitions for the first four news). If you have defined four templates, but only have two news to display, then only two news will be displayed.
NewsList sets to "PageStartPublish" and to by default.

member.example: Example usage of NewsList with special design for the first news.

member.summary: Default template for pages

member.summary: Default template for pages

member.summary: The template for the third item

member.summary: The template for the fourth item

member.summary: Called once when the control needs access to pre sort filters used for modifying a .

remarks.para: Override this method to customize the population of filters to run before sorting occurs.
Typical use is to add pages to create a combined list from two or more folders, or to remove pages based that should not appear in listing. For example by using

member.name: M:EPiServer.Web.WebControls.PageDataSource.CreateSortFilters
member.summary: Called once when the control needs access to sort filters used for modifying a .

remarks.para: Override this method to customize the population of sorting filters.
Typically used to change the order between pages, for example with .

Typical use is to limit the number of pages, for example by using or

member.summary: Performs the selection of pages based on the viewPath parameter.
member.remarks: Override this method to implement custom hierarchical behavior.

member.returns: An IHierarchicalEnumerable representing the child structure of the specified path.

member.name: M:EPiServer.Web.WebControls.PageDataSource.InitializePageLoader(EPiServer.Web.WebControls.HierarchicalPageLoader)
member.summary: Initialize the PageLoader with callbacks and filters. Can be overloaded to change the GetPageCallback, InitializeCallback, and InitializeCallback on the HierarchicalPageLoader object
member.param: object to set the callbacks on
member.remarks: Sets the pageLoader.GetChildrenCallback to get the children with AutoDetect and filters pages with selected access level. Sets the pageLoader.GetPageCallback to get the PageData with AutoDetect. Sets the pageLoader.InitializeCallback to set the loader properties (calls SetLoaderProperties) It also creates presort filters, sort filters, and postsort filters.

member.name: M:EPiServer.Web.WebControls.PageDataSource.SetLoaderProperties
member.summary: Sets the loader properties. This method must be called prior to handing out the loader to the Hierarchical object model (PageHierarchicalEnumerable, PageHierarchicalView etc.)

member.summary: Gets or sets whether to recognize the "visible in menu" setting for pages. If set to true, only pages where PageVisibleInMenu is true will be returned in the result.

member.name: T:EPiServer.Web.WebControls.PageTree
member.summary:
Control for rendering page tree's, extends with templates.
See also ,
member.remarks:
Specify at least to enable rendering, other templates not set will fallback on the most likely substitute If the is set other TopTemplates will fallback to this template insted of the corresponding ItemTemplate.
Keep in mind while inherriting that the template fallback behavior can be modified by overriding any of the virtual InstantiateXXXTemplate methods. If you just want to change in which order the different templates will be used you simply call the InstantiateTemplate method providing the template order you want for your rendering as arguments.
member.example: Example usage of PageTree rendering a simple tree of pages.

member.name: T:EPiServer.Web.WebControls.Property
member.summary: WebControl for rendering page properties.
member.remarks: The Property control is used on web forms and user controls and renders the value of built-in or custom properties to the HTML stream.
member.example:
The following example shows how to print the name of the page to HTML:
The PropertyName attribute is not case sensitive.
For the Property control to be able to read the properties from the page, it needs to be hosted on a web form or a control that implements the IPageSource interface. The control will iterate through the control hierarchy looking for this interface, and when it finds one it will use the CurrentPage property to read the information about the specific built-in or custom property.
If you put a Property control inside a templated control like the PageList control, that implements IPageSource, the Property control will use the CurrentPage property of the template control instead. The PageList then points the Property control to the current PageData object in its internal PageDataCollection. This is why the two following PageList examples will print the same:
You can also access the inner PropertyData object through the InnerProperty property, if you need access to the raw value.

member.name: M:EPiServer.Web.WebControls.Property.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.remarks: This control requires that either the or the property is set for it to work properly.

member.name: M:EPiServer.Web.WebControls.Property.#ctor(EPiServer.Core.PropertyData)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the given instance.

member.summary: Checks if this property control is contained somewhere inside a templated control that fetches a .

member.summary: Gets the content source.

member.summary: Gets the specified content link.

member.summary: Gets the children.

member.name: P:EPiServer.Web.WebControls.Property.ObjectSerializerFactory
member.summary: Gets or sets the object serializer to use when serializing to Json.

member.name: P:EPiServer.Web.WebControls.Property.DisplayMissingMessage
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating if an error message should be displayed if no property with the name provided by could be found.
member.remarks:
If the property pointed to by PropertyName does not exist, an error message will be printed instead. If you want to suppress this error message, set this property to false.
<episerver:property propertyname="MyProperty" runat="server" DisplayMissingMessage='false' />

member.name: P:EPiServer.Web.WebControls.Property.PropertyName
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the property that should be displayed by this control.
member.remarks: Please note that the PropertyName attribute is not case sensitive.
member.example:
The following example shows how to print the name of the page to HTML:
<episerver:property propertyname="PageName" runat="server" />

member.name: P:EPiServer.Web.WebControls.Property.EditMode
member.summary: Controls if the property should render it's edit mode.
member.remarks:
By setting the EditMode property to true the property will be rendered in "edit view", just like it is when viewed through the Editors View.
Note: Any changes to the edit control will be saved if you enter DOPE mode on the page and save it, or call the OnDopeSave() client side method from client side script.
<episerver:property editmode="True" runat="server" propertyname="MainBody" /> <button onclick="OnDopeSave()">Save</button>

member.name: P:EPiServer.Web.WebControls.Property.Editable
member.summary: Controls if the property is editable with DOPE
member.remarks:
The Property control will give you DOPE (Direct On Page Editing) support if the underlaying template page supports it (any web form that inherits directly or indirectly from TemplatePage. If you do not want DOPE support you can either inherit from SimplePage, or set the Editable property to false, like this:
<episerver:property propertyname="PageName" runat="server" Editable='false' />

member.name: P:EPiServer.Web.WebControls.Property.ValidationGroup
member.summary: Gets or sets the validation group.

member.name: P:EPiServer.Web.WebControls.Property.RenderSettings
member.summary: Gets or sets any render settings for the property.
member.value: The render settings for the property.
member.remarks: These settings can vary from property to property, consult the documentation for each property for more details on custom properties.

member.name: P:EPiServer.Web.WebControls.Property.EditorSettings
member.summary: Gets or sets any editor settings for the property.
member.value: The editor settings for the property.
member.remarks: These settings can vary from property to property, consult the documentation for each property for more details on custom properties.

member.name: P:EPiServer.Web.WebControls.Property.OverlaySettings
member.summary: Gets or sets any overlay settings for the property.
member.value: The overlay settings for the property.
member.remarks: These settings can vary from property to property, consult the documentation for each property for more details on custom properties.

member.name: P:EPiServer.Web.WebControls.Property.CustomTagName
member.summary: Gets or sets the tag name. If not set a span-tag will be used.
member.example: Set to "h1" to create a h1-tag around the content.

member.name: P:EPiServer.Web.WebControls.Property.PageLink
member.summary: The root page to read data from if different from current
member.remarks:
If you do not want the Property web control to retrieve the property value from the currently loaded page (or the current page in a PageDataCollection when inside a templated web control) you can set the PageLink to point to another page.
The PageLink property is a PageReference, but you can also assign an int (the ID of the page.)
<episerver:property runat="server" propertyname="MainBody" PageLink="30" />
or:
<episerver:property runat="server" propertyname="MainBody" PageLink='<%# EPiServer.Global.EPConfig.StartPage%>' />

member.name: P:EPiServer.Web.WebControls.Property.PageLinkProperty
member.summary: The property that contains the root page to read data from if different from current

member.summary: Gets or sets the scope name separator.
member.remarks: The default value is '.'.

member.name: T:EPiServer.Web.WebControls.SearchDataSource
member.summary: Provides PageData data to DataBoundControl implementations by searching based on various criteria.

example.para: For more information see the article Data Source Controls.
See the public templates package Search.aspx template for an example of SearchDataSource.

member.name: M:EPiServer.Web.WebControls.SearchDataSource.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:EPiServer.Web.WebControls.SearchDataSource.#ctor(EPiServer.Core.SearchIndexConfig)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:EPiServer.Web.WebControls.SearchDataSource.CreateFileSearchMatch(System.String,System.String,System.DateTime,System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Create a file search match that can be added to the PageSearch results. This function is called by PopulatePages() for each file match. Override this function to customize the PageData instance that holds the file search match.
member.param: Relative or absolute Url to matched file
The date when the file was last modified
member.returns: An initialized PageData instance that can be added to the PageSearch results (a PageDataCollection).

member.name: M:EPiServer.Web.WebControls.SearchDataSource.CreateFileSearchMatch(System.String,System.String,System.DateTime,System.Int32,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Create a file search match that can be added to the PageSearch results. This function is called by PopulatePages() for each file match. Override this function to customize the PageData instance that holds the file search match.
member.param: Relative or absolute Url to matched file
The date when the file was last modified
Url to an icon that represents the file
member.returns: An initialized PageData instance that can be added to the PageSearch results (a PageDataCollection).

member.name: P:EPiServer.Web.WebControls.SearchDataSource.SearchQuery
member.summary: Search query string.
member.remarks: If SearchQuery is empty and the Criterias collection contains at least one PropertyCriteria, the search will be performed using . Default you will only get hits on pages where PageVisibleInMenu is true. If you want to get hits on pages where PageVisibleInMenu is false you need to set the property to false.

member.name: P:EPiServer.Web.WebControls.SearchDataSource.SearchFiles
member.summary: A flag to tell whether files should be included in the search or not.

member.name: P:EPiServer.Web.WebControls.SearchDataSource.SearchLocations
member.summary: A comma separated string of file system locations used as starting locations when searching for files.

remarks.para: If empty, will search in all unified directories.
You can set more than one location by building a comma-separated list of paths.

member.name: P:EPiServer.Web.WebControls.SearchDataSource.MaxAllowHits
member.summary: By default no more than 100 hits can be returned for performance reasons

member.name: P:EPiServer.Web.WebControls.SearchDataSource.Criteria
member.summary: The search criterias that limit the search
member.remarks:
The in the Criterias collection may be used in two different ways
If is not empty, the criteria in the collection will be converted to filters and applied to the result of the text search.
If is empty, there will be no text search. Instead the search will be resolved using based on the Criterias collection.

member.name: P:EPiServer.Web.WebControls.SearchDataSource.LanguageBranches
member.summary: Gets or sets a comma separated list of the language branches to be searched in.

member.name: P:EPiServer.Web.WebControls.SearchDataSource.PageCriteriaSearchService
member.summary: Gets or sets the that is used internally in this instance.

member.name: P:EPiServer.Web.WebControls.SearchDataSource.OnlyWholeWords
member.summary: A flag to control if the search will match only whole words. If False, the search will match all words that begin with the words in the query (word* match).

member.name: P:EPiServer.Web.WebControls.SearchDataSource.MainCatalog
member.summary: The index server catalog to search in.

member.name: P:EPiServer.Web.WebControls.SearchDataSource.MainScope
member.summary: The scope parameter for index server searches. The default is deep traversal under the catalog root.

member.name: T:EPiServer.Web.WebControls.FullRefreshPropertiesMetaData
member.summary: Renders a hidden input element with a data-epi-full-refresh-property-names attribute containing a comma separated list of names of properties that requires a full page refresh when edited.
member.remarks: Make sure that this control is used somewhere in the markup if you have registered any properties for full refresh. The list of property names is collected from .

member.name: M:EPiServer.Web.WebControls.FullRefreshPropertiesMetaData.Render(System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter)
member.summary: Renders a hidden input element with a data-epi-full-refresh-property-names attribute containing a comma separated list of names of properties that requires a full page refresh when edited.
member.param: The object that receives the control content.
member.remarks: Make sure that this control is used somewhere in the markup if you have registered any properties for full refresh. The list of property names is collected from .

member.name: T:EPiServer.Web.WebControls.Translate
member.summary: WebControl for language specific strings.

remarks.para: Use the Translate control to translate your own strings or one of the built in strings in the /lang directory of you site. The test shown will vary by the current users chosen language (if chosen) or the system default.
The control uses the to translate the text. You can access the LocalizationService through code using the static property.

example.para:
This will show the translated value for the /button/search language resource.
<episerver:translate text="/button/search" runat="server"/>

EPiServer can also translate ASP Controls like the Label web control. In the PreRender event EPiServer will search all known controls in the control hierarchy with an attribute called translate (case insensitive) and translate the textual value of the control.
example.note: Note: If you do not want automatic translation you can turn it off by setting the AutomaticTranslation property in your template to false.

member.name: M:EPiServer.Web.WebControls.Translate.Render(System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter)
member.summary: Render this control to the output parameter specified.
member.param: The HTML writer to write out to

member.name: P:EPiServer.Web.WebControls.Translate.Text
member.summary: The property that holds the text to be translated.
member.remarks: See for more details.

member.name: P:EPiServer.Web.WebControls.Translate.Language
member.summary: Gets or sets the language code for the target language.
